Name: PyTorch
Author: Facebook
Description: ML library, with support for tensor computing and deep neural networks.

Name: Keras
Author: Keras Team
Description: High-level abstractions for running neural networks in TensorFlow, R

Name: TensorFlow
Author: Google
Description: "TensorFlow is an end-to-end open source platform for machine learning. It has a comprehensive, flexible ecosystem of tools, libraries and community resources that lets researchers push the state-of-the-art in ML and developers easily build and deploy ML powered applications." Includes support for tensor computing and deep neural networks.

Name: Pandas
Author: Pandas (community)
Description: DataFrames allow data manipulation for reading, writing, transforming data.

Name: Orange
Author: University of Ljubljana
Topic: Data mining, data visualization, machine learning
Description: Visual programming software for data analysis.

Name: Anaconda
Author: Anaconda, Inc.
Description: Free and open-source distribution of the Python and R programming languages for scientific computing, with simplified package management and deployment.

Name: Deep Reinforcement Learning Algorithms with PyTorch
Author: Christodoulou, P.
Description: "This repository contains PyTorch implementations of deep reinforcement learning algorithms and environments."

Name: YOLO: Real-Time Object Detection
Author: Redmon, J.
Description: One of the best and fastest real-time object detection implementations

Name: Colaboratory
Author: Google
Description: Python notebook environment

Name: ONNX
Author: Facebook, Microsoft
Description: "ONNX is an open format built to represent machine learning models. ONNX defines a common set of operators - the building blocks of machine learning and deep learning models - and a common file format to enable AI developers to use models with a variety of frameworks, tools, runtimes, and compilers." It allows for interoperability between ML frameworks.

Name: CNTK
Author: Microsoft
Description: Integrated in ONNX

Name: Caffe2
Author: University of California, Berkeley
Description: Integrated in PyTorch

Name: Seaborn
Author: New York University
Description: "Seaborn is a Python data visualization library based on matplotlib. It provides a high-level interface for drawing attractive and informative statistical graphics."

Name: PyTorch Hub
Author: Facebook
Description: Repository for pre-trained machine learning models.

Name: scikit-learn
Author: scikit-learn (community)
Description: ML library for most algorithms, with the exception of deep learning algorithms.

Name: spaCy
Author: Explosion AI
Description: Advanced natural language processing focusing on providing software for production usage.

Name: Unity Machine Learning Agents Toolkit
Author: Unity Technologies
Description: Reinforcement learning and evolutionary algorithms for agent-based simulation in virtual environments.

Name: KNIME
Author: KNIME (community)
Description: Visual programming software for data analysis.

Name: PyTorch Lightning
Author: PyTorch Lightning (community)
Description: Wrapper for PyTorch; automates boilerplate code.

Name: Tune
Author: Ray (community)
Description: Hyperparameter tuning for various ML frameworks

Name: Flambé
Author: ASAPP Research
Description: Framework for machine learning pipelines

Name: Machinable
Author: Machinable (community)
Description: Framework for machine learning pipelines

Name: Onepanel
Author: Onepanel, Inc.
Description: Platform for computervision pipelines (from labelling to training)

Name: PyOD
Author: Zhao, Yu
Description: PyOD is a comprehensive and scalable Python toolkit for detecting outlying objects in multivariate data. This exciting yet challenging field is commonly referred as Outlier Detection or Anomaly Detection.

Name: OpenRefine
Author: Google
Description: OpenRefine (previously Google Refine) is a powerful tool for working with messy data: cleaning it; transforming it from one format into another; and extending it with web services and external data.

Name: Omega ML
Description: omega|ml is the innovative Python-native DataOps and MLOps platform that provides a ready-to-use data science workbench, development and runtime environment. Works from laptop to cloud.

Name: Kedro
Description: Kedro is an open-source Python framework for creating reproducible, maintainable and modular data science code. It borrows concepts from software engineering and applies them to machine-learning code; applied concepts include modularity, separation of concerns and versioning.
